{"step_by_step_thinking": "The hypothalamus controls the pituitary gland, which in turn releases hormones. The hypothalamus releases inhibitory hormones to control the release of certain hormones from the pituitary gland. Prolactin and growth hormone are both under the inhibitory control of the hypothalamus. The hypothalamus releases dopamine to inhibit the release of prolactin and somatostatin to inhibit the release of growth hormone.", "answer_choice": "D. Both prolactin and growth hormone"}
